author: Be_Burger
title: The Valiant Elf
review:
This elf minifigure is one of the most highly sough after minifigure in this round, and for good reason. He looks awesome, has impressive new pieces, and even has little pointy ears! Who couldn't resist getting this guy? Lets talk more about him.

Parts

  • The elf has many nice new pieces. He has a new bow piece, which is taller and more elegant than the original bow. There is also his hair, neatly combed backwards with cute, pointy yellow ears. His head, shield, torso and printed pants are all nice additions as well.

Playability

  • I can imagine that many people would enjoying playing with this guy, seriously who doesn't like elfs?! I hope Lee Jones leaves some for us :P

Value

  • For TLG's $2.99 pricetag, I think this figure is definitely worth it. He's a great addition to any minifigure collection!

Overall

  • Overall, I think that he is definitely a desirable minifigure and if you don't know which figure to get I'd recommend this one!

author: justind
title: Impossible to get
review:
One of the best series 3 figures

Pros

  • Lots of custom features here not seen in other minifigs
  • Beautiful paint work

Cons

  • Impossible to find - maybe 3 of these per box of minifigs

Despite being one of the best of the series, this figure is just about impossible to find.  Unless you are lucky enough to find a new box of minifigs you won't be able to get one of these.  There are only 3 per box and they go fast.  Compare that to the 20 or so Sumo Wrestlers per box.  :(

author: rafalko
title: it should have been rapper...
review:
Today I was looking for new people from the 3rd series. Till today I already had a baseball and a tennis player. There was no problem with recognizing of the both hidden people, but unfortunately all other sets were not recognizable at all - so I have chosen only 2 sets I thought I was sure what was inside.

Now I saw over 30-40 sets - only 2 of them were recognizable (in my opinion). One of them was gorilla guy - perfect match, but the second one should have been rapper, and was elf...

Pros

  • Very nice looking colours of torso and legs
  • Perfect printings of the armor
  • Interesting hair piece and face
  • Beautiful green cape
  • New very good looking long bow (except of arrow)

Cons

  • The hands and legs move too loose - it may be, that only mine figure has such defect. Why is it so? Is it only the one time imperfection or some of you do have the same problem?
  • Bow - I could never (and will never) understand how come that arrow holds on the lego bow all the time - it's against the natural philosophy ;)
  • Elf is the first bowman (since 1984), who has a shield! - who could have such a weird idea to give him both bow and shield? Does the lego elf have more hands than a proper human bowman?
  • Why didn't elf get a shield and a long sword instead of a long bow? In my opinion it would be the perfect match! And in such a match for me such warrior would get the highest note.
  • And last but not least: the long bow, as well as the common bow (27 years old, and still the same!) are very delicate - it is enough to grab it once to leave a track on it...

 

Too bad there was no elf long sword - instead of the bow - in the set...

author: Dr__Kilroy
title: A Truly Wonderful Minifig
review:
Hey! In my opinion the Elf fig is the most wonderful fig out of the first four minifig series! Simply the best!

First of all, it has tons of nice accessories: the best shield ever carried by a minifig, the new longbow and the dark green cape. All of them is unique and wonderful. And if it is an Elf, it must have those special 'peaked' ears and blonde hair: and yes it has. So as the beautifully painted torso and legs.

The designers have proved their perfect taste, and the result is the perfect aesthetics of a fig one can imagine.

The final bonus makes this fig the best of the whole collectable minigure series is the quality. Although it has been manufactured in China, the Elf fig is perfectly crafted: there is no quality issue with this one at all. It is as good as any figure from a european made building set.

Don't hesitate to buy as much as you can get, this one is will give you enchanted time when you play with it and it provides outstanding value for your money!

author: Cowbell03
title: Perfect for a fantasy battle reenactment. Somewhat reminds me of Lord of the Rings?
review:
I only found this adorable minifigure by luck. I found at least two in the box I was looking though, so if someone beats you to this awesome 'fig, no worries - there's bound to be another.

Anywho, now for the pros and cons.

Pros

  • New accessories, such as new longbow mould, fantasy shield design and two awesome pointy ears!
  • Find a few of these, put them with a few dark warriors, and voila - you have a perfect fantasy battle reenactment. 
  • Only a few being made, so no doubt a collectors item.


Cons

  • As I said above, only a few being made. Yes, this kinda fits in both pros and cons; they won't last for long, so get 'em while you can!

I hope this review helped. Oh, one last thing - if you happen to be searching for one, it's certainly a bumpy packet. Quite a few extra items; I found this long bow and the shield quite a distinguishing feature!

author: wander099
title: Elf!
review: I found this one by accident while I was looking for my samurai warrior and I couldn't resist getting it.  The overall look is great, I love the green colour scheme and the hairpiece is really nice too.  It comes with a great fantasy design on the shield and a long bow, which I have never seen before in a lego set.  I think that this is a great character to get as I can't imagine anyone not wanting an elf.  My tip for finding it is to feel for the shape of the shield, that's how I found mine.

author: Brickman193
title: The Long-Awaited Elf
review:
I finally found the Elf at Target tonight, amongst a wreck of half-opened and empty packets. Good to see some of them escaped the more ambitious collectors out there.


PROS
  • Awesome hair, torso, cape and legs. All befitting a woodland warrior, and relatively unique.
  • Long bow makes a comeback.
  • The fact that it the Elf, that alone makes him worth it. We've had trolls and dwarves, the Elf is a nice addition.
CONS
  • The Elf is POPULAR. There are few Elves in a complete box, and even less after the eager collectors come in. If you find the Elf, buy him ASAP!

Overall, the parts are rather mundane, and the set doesn't match up to the Spartan of Series 2, but the Elf is still an awesome minifig to have, and the highlight of any collection. If you're a Fantasy LEGO fan, or a fan of Lord of the Rings, make sure you secure an Elf!

author: legospongepotter
title: Yes, it is Legolas
review:
Well of COURSE it is Legolas from the great Lord of the Rings (I'm reading the series and I saw the films). I hope many of you noticed that his name is LEGOlas. 

This is probably one of the best Series 3 Minifigures and one of the greatest Minifigures of all time, and there are many reasons why. To start off, you get lots of great green colors and I believe everything except the bow is new.

Hair

The elf has white-ish/tan-ish/blond-ish hair. I guess it's a sandy color, really. All his hair smoothly glides backwards into small little stubs of hair on the back. His hair is also designed to have ears on them. It's really kind of part of the hair but printed yellow. However, it's pointy and cool nonetheless. 
The only way his hair could be better is if the hair was designed so the ears actually stick out a little more. It's still cool, though and it's new. It's recolored to be brown and black in the Series 4 Werewolf. I hope this hair gets used a lot. Maybe in the future we'll have blue hair with purple ears. Anything's possible when it comes to Legos. 

Head

Next, we have the head. As you can see from the picture, the elf has a rather determined expression. You an see his cheekbones and his thin brown eyebrows. I don't understand the brown color, though. Shouldn't it be blond? His mouth is curved in a frown. If he was smiling, then he would definitely be Legolas. his skin, of course, is yellow. He has one face.

Torso

His torso is brand new, as well. The printing is fantastic. You can see a silver belt along the bottom with a green emerald. He is wearing chain mail, and the detail is great with the silvery design. Around his neck is something brown that I have not figured out entirely. Some kind of sash? Possibly for arrows? The part where his green cloak fastens around his neck is printed, which is AWESOME. His arms are light green and his hands are yellow. The light green is a rare color when it comes to clothing, though it is the same color as roof pieces in Harry Potter. There is no back-printing.

Legs

The elf has brown legs with printing. Along his waist part there is some chain mail, which continues down his leg. There are some light brown pockets to go along. These legs are really great and are actually one of my favorite parts of the set.

Shield

I believe this shied is new. It is gray along the edges and there is a bronze border with silvery designs along it. Inside the border is the same color green as the cloak with silver lines across, and a deer with great antlers printed in the middle like a symbol of peace or something. Well, the deer looks mad so maybe a symbol of nature.... Anyway there is a handle on the back for the elf to hold it and is an excellent piece.

Bow and Arrow

This is basically the only piece that isn't new. However, it is still my first and remains cool. It is brown and looks like an bow getting ready to fire, with a brown arrow sticking out, preparing to fire. Along with the shield, you can stage great battles with this elf if you have this. Maybe if you want to make a Lord of the Rings MOC then soem of these would be helpful.

Cloak

This is the least special part of the set, which means its speciality on a 1 to 100 scale would be 95. It is a normal cloaks that goes around the neck and is held in place by the head. It is dark forest green, which I think is new.

Stand

This is the normal black stand that comes with every Collectable Minifigure. It is black and has four studs across in the middle.

Overall

This is my first amazingly stupendous Minifigure. There are so many details and it's a favorite of mine. There are sets that cost thirty, forty dollars that aren't as good as this set. I would highly recommend getting it. I only have two complaints: There should be a quiver for arrows, and I think it would've been cooler if he was smiling like Legolas does, or perhaps he had a double-printed head with a smile. Overall, this is a great Minifigure and no true Lego fan could stand being without it.

author: itsaturkey
title: LEGOLAS! Right?
review:
The Elf is one of the best CM's out their.
Building Experience:
What can I say, it's a minifig.

Parts: Are those Lego elf ears i see? YES! Although it's not attached to the head, it makes some VERY comical MOCing. A brand new (Right?) green cape, and a cool green chain mail torso.The Shield has an interesting deer emblem, and some elfish green and brown coloring. The bow is a...bow. Oh one more thing, before you faint of amazement of super minifigness, the plastic is.......CHINEASE PLASTIC! "Scream" Also included is a black stand.

Playability: Well if you have another minifig you can have a epic duel. Or if you're a AFOL, they are AWESOME for sitting on a bookshelf for decorations (in fact I believe you can get a case for them.

Price Value: Depends on where you buy him. Toys R Us sells em at 5 bucks (where i live) which is NOT a very good deal. If you see one of these for $3 or $2, I would get him. $4 is pushing it for any minifig, but with all of his rare pieces, I'd say it would be worth it.

Overall: Excellent minifig, good pieces, and in some places good price. I Hope this review helped!
P.S. Doesn't he look like Legolas?

author: Shistavanen_brick
title: Bado na Ennorath (Go to Middle Earth).
review:
This is one of the highlights of the collectible series 3 line, although it's pretty rare to find if you don't make use of either the dot-system or better still - identify by touch. When I did that I could get two of these guys at the same time rather than rely only on the dot-system or taking a lucky chance and just buy and hope for the best. Easiest way to feel through the bag would be his shield and bow.

The Elf.

All right, so that is that. Let's go onto the figure itself. I must say this is the most wonderful minifigure, it has very cool elvish markings on the body, chainmail printing and also details as cloak clasp. Colours are mostly green and brown with this guy (maybe for obvious reasons, being a forest-type kind of guy!) and it's very balanced colour scheme for the entire figure. The head has a serious face and some great "slender" markings on the side. Hair-piece has the elven ears (!) to further complete the elvish look. A future Elvish battle pack would be nice, of course...

Accessories for arms.

The elf comes with an elvish style bow which is very nice indeed. The green cloak matches perfectly to the general appearence of this guy and has a nice forest colour. Then there's the amazing shield. I've never seen such a nice printing on a shield I think. Golden frame and silver patterns on the edge and a nice silver fantasy deer-head in the middle on a green base. So you can say there's a lot of things going on with this one, not like the race car driver, which comes with a helmet - and that's pretty much it. With the Elf, the value for money is great.


Pros:

  • A great figure as a whole. Perfect for an unexpected and welcome appearence in a castle themed village or forest adventure.
  • Nice markings on shield and body.
  • Lots of accessories.
  • Fantastic collectible value.


Cons:
  • Very hard to find if you don't know what to look for, but even then...
  • Maybe should have come with a cool sword?

author: AETerry
title: Elf Minifigure Review
review:
I found Legolas!

 

I was rather pleasantly surprised and pleased to see that the Collector Minifigures were on the shelf at my local Wal-Mart today. I was giving up hope on seeing anything show up in my area due to location and small county, small town.

 

The elf was in the first package I opened up and he is one of the minifigures from series 3 that I've been really wanting. So that was high on the awesome factor for me as a collector.

 

Looks wise, he is just one of the best minifigures in this series. The hair piece is sculpted or molded to give the appearance of pointed ears, he's got a very unique long bow piece that I have not seen with other Castle themed sets, a unique sheild, green cape and torso printing.

 

From the pictures, it's easy to see why everyone wants this minifigure and then once you have it in hand to look at, you're not disappointed and it is truely a beautiful piece.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Legolas is that You?
review:
Set #8803 Elf: The ultimate Mini-Figure in Series 3, this one is the most sought after, the toughest to find and a real Scalper magnet. (And I've got two of him.)

 

The Elf has a nice chainmail print on his torso and upper legs. There is a jewel in the center of his belt and his facial print evokes a serious expression of some kind. The hairpiece includes two pointed ears on either side to make the Elf look like an Elf. He comes with a new version of a long bow, the piece is diffierent from the standard Castle long bow and looks rather... Elven.

 

The shield accessory is the standard long shield, but with a great looking print on the front, it's a Stag with dangerous looking antlers in the center of a field of green and surrounded by a bronze looking trim. It's really quite interesting looking. The Elf also includes a green cape, what's good about this is that his chest print has a green cape clasp covering his neck, so it goes well together.

 

Overall I'd have to say that this is a great Mini-Figure for your collection and will go well in your Fantasy Era Castle display. Try and get multiples of him because it's great for new LEGO figures and MOCs.

author: fluffycat0509
title: Elf
review:
All of the parts of this minifigure are very realistic and elf-like, except... I have never seen an elf with short hair. This minifigure would have been perfect if the elf had long hair, like an elf usually has. If it were not for the lego hair, this minifgure would have been one of the best of the Collectible Minifigures.

 

Parts: The hair comes with elf ears! Also comes with a cool dark green cape, a new green chain mail torso, and his shield has an interesting deer emblem. It also comes with a new large bow (better than the old lego bow)!

 

Overall this is a highly recommended minifigure. Put it in your castle minifigures collection. It's also worth the price! You can get it for $5 or $7 on Bricklink. I hope this review has been helpful to you!

author: Tonebone0011
title: Please release a Forest Elves set!!
review:
Lego collectors tend to buy up all the packets the second they hit the shelves. I was fortunate enough to have a wonderful store employee go to the stockroom and bring out a brand new box of these! I spent about a half hour with some older lego collector feeling out the packs, trying to guess what is in what. The older guy was better at feeling it and found the elf and the samurai for me, what a lucky day this is!

Pros

  • Pro 1 One of the better looking castle themed minifigs and in my opinion the best choice out of the 4 minifigure series.
  • Pro 2 If you're a castle collector, you'll love this figure, its highly detailed, fully decked out with accessories, and is exactly what the forestmen should look like.
  • Pro 3 Cool pointy eared hairpiece
  • Pro 4 Looks like Legolas from Lord of the Rings

Cons

  • Con 1 May be very hard to get
  • Con 2 The longbow is a two handed weapon which makes it an odd choice for him to hold a shield but the shield is a very welcome added bonus. Makes it easier to spot for when feeling for it
  • Con 3 one of the more expensive of the series to obtain through auctions, etc. To this date, they are selling for around $10-12 after shipping on ebay.
  • …

I really hope they come out with an elf set after they realize the popularity of this figure. I feel that the forestmen castles are some of the more beautiful ones, with the trees surrounding the castle. They look more organic and more interesting visually than sleeker stone castles, not that the stone castles are not worth collecting, they're super awesome to build as well

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Collectable Minifigures (Series 3) - Elf Review
review:
When I looked at the minifig first, I thought that the figure looks like Legolas from the Lord of the Rings series - even if the real Legolas version from LEGO looks much different than this one. The hair piece and the bow have a new mould and I also love the printings on the shield, the torso and the legs. I've to say that this is one of the BEST minifigs of series 3 so far.

All in all it's a great set to get and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

author: Harmonious_Building
title: Elf consciousness.
review:
You have all been fooled.

A cursory glance at this very special Collectible Minifig - with whom everyone is enamoured because of his approximate appearance to Legolas from The Lord of the Rings films and because Tolkien-esque Elves have never before been featured in the LEGO universe - leads everyone to conclude that this Minifig is, well, a representation of Legolas from The Lord of the Rings films. I submit to you, however, the nonconformist opinion that he is not, and, in fact, far from being enamoured with Elf, we should all find ourselves severely annoyed by him.

Sure, there are some telltale signs - the flowing dark green cloak, the longbow, the pointy ears - but there is one piece of compelling evidence that gives everything away, and that is the shield, upon which is adorned the stylised logo of a deer or an elk. Look familiar? Perhaps the phrase "Dark Forest" rings a bell? Indeed, this obscure, reclusive, almost cult-like faction of LEGO Castle saw a grand total of three sets before fading into the shadows, frustrating future LEGO collectors for ages onwards who wish to partake in their ultra-coolness but are prevented from doing so due to their current and forevermore prohibitive price and inexplicable rarity. Indeed, with the possible exception of Fantasy Era’s Dwarves, Dark Forest is probably the most unique Castle subtheme, one that we are all hoping for a spiritual successor to but never get because LEGO is a cruel mistress.

What, then, are we supposed to make of Elf’s pointy ears and angry appearance? It’s quite simple. When the Dark Forest faction dissolved, the grand majority of its members were arrested and executed or otherwise forced to integrate into proper Castle society. A few, however, escaped into the titular Dark Forest forever, but the magic of the forest changed these Minifigs permanently, the result of which is this Elf, referred to colloquially as such by all who see him. He is all that remains of the Dark Forest.

Is this a cool Minifig? Of course he is. You didn’t need another review to tell you that. In fact, if you are even a passing fan of Castle, you should do all that you can to get him immediately before he starts routinely going for $50 a pop, following exactly in the league of his legendary Dark Forest counterparts. My whole point here is to remind you that once upon a time, there was a clan known as Dark Forest, and they are waiting in the silence of the woods to be reborn. Or rebooted. Or re-released. I’ll take any or all of the aforementioned options.

author: Rocka_3_0
title: He didn't eat his green vegetables!
review:
I think the Elf is the best Collectable Minifig so far, the hair piece is so cool!

And the longbow piece has returned, along with a printed sheild!

 

Parts

The parts in this set are really nice, especially the longbow, sheild, and the hair!

The hair is in a swept-back style with pointed ears! Love the ears! It's the coolest part of this set!

His chest has a chain-mail shirt, a belt with a green jewl in the middle, and a dark green scarf that looks like it connects to the cape.

The legs have a little bit of chain-mail on the top, and below the are boot folds.

The sheild has a picture of a buck in silver, and around the rim it is dark yellow with silver pin-stripe pattern. And it accually not new, see? http://www.bricklink.com/catalogItem.asp?P=770

The head has a determined expession and brown eyebrows.

The build

It's a minifig, right? What do you expect?

The completed minifigure

I think the Elf is the best minifig so far, he is very detailed and is a great minifig for Narnia or Lord of the Rings Mocs. 

Summary

The Elf is a very good figure, I reccomend him to enyone and everyone!

author: Proteasome
title: Awesome elf
review:
I got this one yesterday at a dubious store where they still had a huge load of series 3 mini figs, and i was feeling out all of them to try and find one of these, almost at the end i finally got one, and picked it up, together with the space villain, the chief and the samurai dude, for the whopping price of 1eu per mini fig.

I really wanted this one, well, because it's awesome. and i was not disappointed. I love the shield, and the bow (would be awkward to use them at the same time, but I'm not complaining)
also the torso and legs look superb. The only downside in my opinion is that the head is yellow, so it looks a bit out of place with the lotr sets with mini figs with skin coloured heads. (or is that the fault of the other mini figs?)

Anyway, great mini fig, and it was definitely worth the effort of searching!

author: Nebski
title: Simply Beautiful
review:
This figure has received a lot of great reviews and it most deservedly so. Because it has captured the essence of how a wood elf looks like translated to LEGO. While I do not really understand how the bow and the shield could work together technically speaking, they more than made up for just complimenting the minifigure itself. 

This is one of those minifigures you would appreciate on its own, and even more so if you amass an army of it.

author: sideswinger
title: An INCREDIBLE figure!
review:
So the ninth figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 3 is the Elf, and I LOVE this figure. He was released in 2011, retailed for three dollars, and includes eight pieces, if you do count the display stand. So let's take a closer look!

On top we have that hair/ear combo, which looks brilliant. It was new for the figure too, which is even cooler. I don't think it was dual-moulded, but rather the ears were printed, and I love how that all came out. You might think it was used for Legolas in the Lord of the Rings sets, but nope. They used a different piece for that. I don't mind though.

Then we have his face, which I like how you could use it for generic LEGO minifigures, as well as specific ones. That angry look really goes with anything. No alternate face printing, which is common for lots of CMF's.

And his cape is next. It's done in green as well, with no printing or anything, but that's fine. It's just cool that they included it at all. It is that old, thicker material as well, which is to be expected. Let's just move right on to his torso, which has some awesome printing. I love how all that came out, with the continuing green cape design, and it's just really complex for its time. No alternate printing, but it is neat how the arms are done in sand green.

Next are his legs, and they have some cool printing on them as well. I really love those green flakes on front, as well as what appears to be boots. He does look kind of strange without side leg printing, but that's okay since this is an excellent figure otherwise.

And then lastly, we have his accessories, which look awesome as well. He has that reddish-brown bow and arrow, which isn't a rare piece whatsoever, and it has appeared in several CMF's. But that's fine, because it's very fitting. But then he also has that awesome shield. I really love the printing on it too, with the deer and all, and I just love how that all turned out.

And that's really my overall opinion of this figure. I just really love how he turned out. First off, this series is not at all one of the best, but this figure is one hundred percent my favorite in the series. And not just that, it's one of my favorite CMF's ever. Definitely my favorite CMF ever. There's been three CMF elves; one in Series 9, and the other in Series 17. The Series 17 is a close one, but I like this dude much more than the Series 9 one. And for three dollars, this is great value. And I think that's it for this review! So read my other Series 1, 2, and 3 revies, and thank you for reading!
